title: Guitar Fretboard — Scales & Modes

modeDescriptions.jonio: Bright, happy sound — the traditional major scale
modeDescriptions.dorico: Minor with a major 6th — jazzy and sophisticated
modeDescriptions.frigio: Minor with a minor 2nd — exotic and Spanish-flavored
modeDescriptions.lidio: Major with a raised 4th — ethereal and mysterious
modeDescriptions.mixolidio: Major with a minor 7th — rock and blues
modeDescriptions.locrio: Diminished and unstable — rarely used in popular music
modeDescriptions.penta_maior: 5 notes from the major scale — versatile and consonant, widely used in rock, country, and pop
modeDescriptions.penta_menor: 5 notes from the minor scale — essential for blues, rock, and improvisation
modeDescriptions.blues_menor: Minor pentatonic + b5 — the classic blues sound
modeDescriptions.blues_maior: Major pentatonic + b3 — bright blues with a major feel
modeDescriptions.harmonic_minor: Natural minor with raised 7th — dramatic and classical
modeDescriptions.melodic_minor: Natural minor with raised 6th and 7th — smooth and jazzy
modeDescriptions.hungarian_minor: Harmonic minor with raised 4th — exotic and intense
modeDescriptions.phrygian_dom: 5th mode of harmonic minor — flamenco and Middle Eastern
modeDescriptions.lydian_s2: 6th mode of harmonic minor — augmented second gives exotic color
modeDescriptions.lydian_dom: 4th mode of melodic minor — Lydian with a b7, used in jazz fusion
modeDescriptions.altered: 7th mode of melodic minor — all altered tensions, dominant resolution
modeDescriptions.whole_tone: 6 equally spaced whole steps — dreamy and ambiguous
modeDescriptions.dim_hw: Alternating half-whole steps — dominant diminished, 8 notes
modeDescriptions.dim_wh: Alternating whole-half steps — diminished 7th chord scale, 8 notes
